segments.en: And today we're going to be bringing you another great sports lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来另一堂精彩的体育课。

segments.en: Yes, this one is for all our hockey fans.
segments.cn: 是的，这一课是为所有冰球迷准备的。

segments.en: I know we have a lot of listeners from Russia, so this is a very popular sport in Russia, Czech Republic.
segments.cn: 我知道我们有很多来自俄罗斯的听众，所以这在俄罗斯和捷克共和国是非常受欢迎的运动。
在加拿大非常非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Well, I guess because you guys have so much ice.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想是因为你们有那么多冰。

segments.en: I know, there's nothing else to do.
segments.cn: 我知道，没什么其他事情可做。

segments.en: Alright, so it's going to be a really fun lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，这将是一堂非常有趣的课。

segments.en: We're going to have a lot of great vocabularies.
segments.cn: 我们将有很多很棒的词汇。

segments.en: So before we start in the dialogue, let's take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 所以在我们开始对话之前，让我们先看看词汇预览。

segments.en: Well, we have three words for you now.
segments.cn: 现在我们有三个词给你。

segments.en: The first one, really simple, puck.
So, it's almost like duck, but with a P. Yes.
segments.cn: 所以，它几乎像鸭子，但有个P。是的。

segments.en: And this is actually kind of like the ball that you use in hockey.
segments.cn: 这实际上就像你在冰球中使用的球。

segments.en: So it looks like a disc.
segments.cn: 所以它看起来像一个圆盘。

segments.en: Kind of like a mini frisbee.
And this is what the players do.
This is what they... They chase this around.
So in basketball you have a ball, in soccer you have a ball, in hockey you have a puck.
segments.cn: 所以在篮球中你有一个球，在足球中你有一个球，在冰球中你有一个冰球。

segments.en: So I can say a key game is a really important game.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说一场关键比赛是一场非常重要的比赛。

segments.en: You could also maybe say a key player.
segments.cn: 你也可以说一个关键球员。

segments.en: A key player is a really important player.
segments.cn: 一个关键球员是一个非常重要的球员。
或者甚至一个关键进球。

segments.en: So let's take a look at our last word now.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看最后一个词。

segments.en: So the finals are the last games.
segments.cn: 所以决赛是最后的比赛。

segments.en: And the winner of the finals wins the championship.
For example in the World Cup in soccer there's only one game played in the finals.
segments.cn: 例如，在足球世界杯中，决赛只进行一场比赛。

segments.en: So after everyone gets eliminated there is one game where the winner is the champion.
segments.cn: 所以在每个人被淘汰后，有一场比赛，赢家就是冠军。

segments.en: So now we're ready to listen to our dialogue and it's going to be a little bit faster than usual.
segments.cn: 现在我们准备好听我们的对话了，它会比平常快一点。

segments.en: And it's exciting and there's a lot of action.
segments.cn: 而且很激动，还有很多动作。

segments.en: So don't worry about it listen to it and then we'll come back and talk about some of the vocabulary.
segments.cn: 所以别担心，听完后我们会回来讨论一些词汇。

segments.en: Hello everyone I'm Rick Fields and here with me is Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 大家好，我是Rick Fields，和我在一起的是Bob Copeland。

segments.en: Howdy folks and welcome to today's game.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到今天的比赛。

segments.en: You know Rick today's a key game between Russia and Canada.
segments.cn: 你知道Rick，今天是俄罗斯和加拿大之间的一场关键比赛。

segments.en: As you know the winner will move on to the finals.
segments.cn: 正如你所知，赢家将晋级决赛。

segments.en: That's right and it looks like we're just about ready to start the match.
segments.cn: 没错，看起来我们就要开始比赛了。

segments.en: The ref is calling the players for the face-off and here we go.
segments.cn: 裁判正在召唤球员进行开球，开始了。

segments.en: The Russians win possession and immediately start up their attack.
segments.cn: 俄罗斯队赢得控球权，立即开始进攻。

segments.en: Fedorov gets checked hard into the boards.
segments.cn: 费多罗夫被狠狠撞到板上。

segments.en: Boris Ryszow has the puck now and he passes it to center he shoots.
segments.cn: 现在鲍里斯·瑞佐夫拿到了冰球，他传给中锋，他射门。

segments.en: Wow what a save by the goalie.
All right the puck is back in play now.
segments.cn: 好的，冰球现在重新开始比赛。

segments.en: Pavel Bory is on a breakaway.
He is flying down the ice.
All right so the Canadians versus the Russians huh?
segments.cn: 好的，加拿大对俄罗斯，是吧？

segments.en: It reminds me of a classic classic game.
segments.cn: 这让我想起了一场经典的比赛。

segments.en: So let's take a look at some of the vocabulary that we heard in the dialogue in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看在对话中听到的一些词汇，在语言收获中。

segments.en: We have five phrases in Language Takeaway today and the first one is face-off.
segments.cn: 今天我们在语言收获中有五个短语，第一个是开球。

segments.en: So Marco a face-off here is a noun right?
segments.cn: 所以Marco，这里对峙是名词，对吧？

segments.en: It's a noun exactly and it's so in the beginning of a match the two players will stand face to face yes right that's why it's called kind of a face-off and the referee will drop the puck yes and they'll try to get it exactly so that's the face-off the face-off yeah okay let's take a look at our next word check check to check
segments.cn: 是的，确切地说，它是名词，比赛开始时，两名选手会面对面站着，是的，这就是为什么叫做对峙，裁判会放下冰球，是的，他们会试图去争夺它，所以这就是对峙，对峙，是的，好吧，让我们看看下一个词，检查，检查，检查

segments.en: to check so an interesting verb here hey yeah it's really interesting because it's different from the way that you would say check or revise yes yeah this is actually kind of a violent move yeah so what do you do it's basically in hockey you take your body and you hit another person with it okay so to check someone is to So, hit them with your body.
segments.cn: 检查，所以这是一个有趣的动词，是吧？
是的，这真的很有趣，因为它与您所说的检查或修订不同，是的，这实际上是一种暴力动作，是的，所以你怎么做？基本上在冰球中，你用身体撞击另一个人。

segments.en: You can't use your arms or your legs or your hands.
You can only hit them with your shoulder or your hip, called a hip check.
A goalie is a person and probably the bravest of the hockey match.
segments.cn: 守门员是一个人，可能是冰球比赛中最勇敢的。

segments.en: So, why don't you tell us what the goalie does?
segments.cn: 那么，你能告诉我们守门员做什么吗？

segments.en: The goalie prevents the puck from coming in the net.
segments.cn: 守门员阻止冰球进入球网。

segments.en: From going into the goal, right?
Yeah, so the goalie stops the other team from getting a goal.
segments.cn: 是的，所以守门员阻止对方得分。

segments.en: Okay, so the goalie prevents the goals.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以守门员阻止进球。

segments.en: Now, our fourth word is related to goalie.
segments.cn: 现在，我们的第四个词与守门员有关。

segments.en: When he stops a goal, he makes a save.
segments.cn: 当他阻止进球时，他进行了一次拯救。

segments.en: Okay, we have some examples so we can understand this form of using save.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些例子，这样我们可以理解这种使用拯救的形式。
那是一次不可思议的拯救！

segments.en: The goalie didn't make the save.
Yeah, a little bit unusual here that save is a noun instead of a verb.
segments.cn: 是的，这里有点不寻常，拯救是名词而不是动词。

segments.en: But I think those examples were helpful.
segments.cn: 但我认为这些例子很有帮助。

segments.en: Now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看最后一个词。

segments.en: Okay, so you have two words there that we know already.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你有两个我们已经知道的词。

segments.en: So what do these two words together actually mean?
segments.cn: 那么这两个词组合在一起实际上是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, imagine a group of hockey players all fighting to get the puck.
segments.cn: 嗯，想象一群冰球运动员都在争夺冰球。

segments.en: And then one player breaks out of the group.
segments.cn: 然后一个球员从队伍中突围。

segments.en: And he skates down the ice and he has the puck.
segments.cn: 他滑下冰面，手里拿着冰球。

segments.en: And he's far away from the other players.
Right, so he's going away from the other players by himself.
segments.cn: 对，所以他独自远离其他球员。

segments.en: Alright, so we've looked at a lot of hockey language here.
segments.cn: 好的，我们已经看了很多冰球语言。

segments.en: And I think it's time now to listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 我认为现在是时候再次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: This time we're going to slow it down a little bit.
segments.cn: 这次我们将稍微放慢速度。

segments.en: Yeah, I think this will help you to understand these words a little bit better.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为这将帮助你更好地理解这些词。

segments.en: And here with me is Bob Copeland.
Howdy folks, and welcome to today's game.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到今天的比赛。

segments.en: You know, Rick, today is a key game between Russia and Canada.
segments.cn: 你知道，Rick，今天是俄罗斯和加拿大之间的关键比赛。

segments.en: As you know, the winner will move on to the finals.
segments.cn: 正如你所知，获胜者将晋级决赛。

segments.en: That's right, and it looks like we're just about ready to start the match.
segments.cn: 没错，看起来我们就要开始比赛了。

segments.en: The ref is calling the players for the faceoff.
segments.cn: 裁判正在召唤球员进行对峙。

segments.en: The Russians win possession and immediately set up their attack.
segments.cn: 俄罗斯赢得控球权，立即展开进攻。

segments.en: Fedorov gets checked hard into the boards.
Mohit Rishad has the puck now and passes it to the center.
segments.cn: Mohit Rishad现在拿着冰球，传给中锋。

segments.en: What a save by the goalie!
Alright, the puck is back in play now.
segments.cn: 好吧，冰球现在重新开始了。

segments.en: Pavel Buray is on a breakaway.
He is flying down the ice.
this dialogue is interesting because we have commentators narrating or describing what's happening in that moment, right?
segments.cn: 这个对话很有趣，因为我们有评论员在叙述或描述当时发生的事情，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and they're using some interesting grammar, aren't they?
segments.cn: 是的，他们使用了一些有趣的语法，不是吗？

segments.en: Exactly, they are, because some actions are happening in that moment, but we notice something a little bit strange.
segments.cn: 确切地说，他们是，因为一些动作正在发生，但我们注意到有点奇怪。

segments.en: Alright, well let's look at it in Grammar Breakdown.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们在语法分析中看看。

segments.en: Okay, let's listen to this sentence that we previously heard in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们听听我们之前在对话中听到的这句话。

segments.en: Mohit Rishad has the puck now and passes it to the center.
segments.cn: Mohit Rishad现在拿着冰球，传给中锋。

segments.en: Mohit Rishad has the puck now and passes it to the center.
segments.cn: Mohit Rishad现在拿着冰球，传给中锋。

segments.en: I notice that he's using the present simple, right?
segments.cn: 我注意到他使用的是现在简单时，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, even though the action is now, it's in present simple.
segments.cn: 是的，即使动作是现在的，它也是现在简单时。

segments.en: Yes, even though the action is happening in that moment, he's not using the present progressive or the present continuous.
segments.cn: 是的，尽管动作在那一刻发生，他并没有使用现在进行时。

segments.en: This is because, if you notice, the actions are very, very brief.
segments.cn: 这是因为，如果你注意到，动作非常非常简短。

segments.en: So you don't really have enough time to say, for example, he is shooting.
segments.cn: 所以你没有足够的时间说，例如，他正在射门。

segments.en: Because it's only one quick action.
segments.cn: 因为这只是一个快速的动作。

segments.en: He shoots the puck very fast, right?
Or, for example, you wouldn't really say he is passing.
segments.cn: 或者，例如，你不会真的说他正在传球。

segments.en: Yeah, he is passing the puck.
Right, it's just one quick action.
segments.cn: 对，这只是一个快速的动作。

segments.en: He takes it and passes it, and the action is finished.
segments.cn: 他接住并传球，动作就结束了。

segments.en: I think we can see a few more examples of this.
segments.cn: 我想我们可以看到更多这样的例子。

segments.en: we can hear that he is using the present simple again, because these are very short actions that finish quickly, right?
segments.cn: 我们可以听到他再次使用一般现在时，因为这些都是很短的动作，快速结束，对吧？

segments.en: And it's actually very, very common when you're describing something you see, that's happening now, that's really exciting.
segments.cn: 而且当你描述一些你看到的、正在发生的、非常刺激的事情时，这实际上是非常非常常见的。

segments.en: It's common to use present simple.
segments.cn: 使用一般现在时是常见的。

segments.en: If you pay attention, most sporting events are in the same way, right?
segments.cn: 如果你注意，大多数体育赛事都是这样，对吧？

segments.en: They would describe the actions that are happening in the present simple, not present progressive.
segments.cn: 他们会用一般现在时来描述正在发生的动作，而不是现在进行时。

segments.en: But Marco, you have an example of some present progressive here, right?
segments.cn: 但是Marco，你这里有一个现在进行时的例子，对吧？

segments.en: Now, we heard the sentence, he is flying down the ice, right?
segments.cn: 现在，我们听到的句子是，他正在冰上飞驰，对吧？

segments.en: Now, this one is in progressive.
Well, first of all, when we say he's flying down the ice, it's not that he's literally flying.
segments.cn: 首先，当我们说他正在冰上飞驰时，并不是说他真的在飞。

segments.en: No, he's not in an airplane.
He's just skating really fast, right?
segments.cn: 他只是滑得非常快，对吧？

segments.en: So, we kind of exaggerate and we say, oh, he's flying down the ice.
segments.cn: 所以，我们有点夸张地说，哦，他正在冰上飞驰。

segments.en: But he's actually skating, so this is a progressive action.
segments.cn: 但他实际上是在滑冰，所以这是一个进行中的动作。

segments.en: It's happening for more than one second.
So, that's why we would say he is flying down the ice instead of he flies down the ice.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是为什么我们会说他正在冰上飞驰，而不是他飞驰在冰上。

segments.en: Unless it was like really, really, really fast.
segments.cn: 除非他真的非常非常快。

segments.en: Okay, so here we see that sometimes in English, we do use present simple to talk about what's happening now, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以在这里我们看到，有时在英语中，我们确实使用一般现在时来谈论现在发生的事情，对吧？

segments.en: When it happens really, really quickly or when we want to show that it's really exciting.
segments.cn: 当它发生得非常非常快，或者当我们想展示它非常刺激时。

segments.en: Makes it much more exciting if we just use the present simple.
segments.cn: 如果我们只使用一般现在时，会让事情变得更加刺激。

segments.en: Okay, let's listen to this exciting dialogue one more time and we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 好的，我们再听一次这个刺激的对话，然后我们会回来再聊聊。

segments.en: I'm Rick Fields and here with me is Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我是Rick Fields，和我在一起的是Bob Copeland。

segments.en: Howdy, folks, and welcome to today's game.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到今天的比赛。

segments.en: You know, Rick, today's a key game between Russia and Canada.
segments.cn: 你知道，Rick，今天是俄罗斯和加拿大之间的关键比赛。

segments.en: As you know, the winner will move on to the finals.
segments.cn: 正如你所知，获胜者将晋级决赛。

segments.en: That's right, and it looks like we're just about ready to start the match.
segments.cn: 没错，看起来我们就要开始比赛了。

segments.en: The ref is calling the players for the face-off, and here we go.
segments.cn: 裁判正在叫球员们进行开球，开始吧。

segments.en: The Russians win possession and immediately start up their attack.
segments.cn: 俄罗斯队赢得控球权，立即开始进攻。

segments.en: Fedorov gets checked hard into the boards.
segments.cn: 费多罗夫被狠狠撞到板上。

segments.en: Boris Ryszow has the puck now, and he passes it to Sender.
segments.cn: 现在，鲍里斯·瑞佐夫拿着冰球，他传给了Sender。

segments.en: Wow, what a save by the goalie!
All right, the puck is back in play now.
segments.cn: 好吧，冰球现在重新开始比赛。

segments.en: Pavel Bory is on a breakaway.
He is flying down the ice.
All right, so hockey is the Canadian national sport.
segments.cn: 好吧，冰球是加拿大的国球。

segments.en: Well, actually, it isn't the national sport.

segments.cn: 它是我们的名字，曲棍球。

segments.en: But anyway, we don't have a lesson about lacrosse today.
segments.cn: 不过，今天我们没有关于曲棍球的课程。

segments.en: But actually, all Canadians love hockey.
segments.cn: 但实际上，所有加拿大人都喜欢冰球。

segments.en: Like, we start playing hockey when we're about two years old.
segments.cn: 就像，我们大约两岁时就开始玩冰球。

segments.en: Yeah, I've heard that some Canadian children learn how to skate before they learn how to walk.
segments.cn: 是的，我听说一些加拿大孩子在学会走路之前就学会滑冰。

segments.en: Well, it is a great sport.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是一项伟大的运动。

segments.en: That's what I like about it.
segments.cn: 这就是我喜欢它的原因。

segments.en: I must tell you that I am not a good Canadian.
segments.cn: 我必须告诉你，我不是一个好加拿大人。

segments.en: It's hard to see where it is on the ice.
segments.cn: 很难看清它在冰上的位置。

segments.en: Have you ever been to a hockey game?
And I just find that the puck is really small.
Maybe you just need better sense.
segments.cn: 也许你只是需要更好的感觉。

segments.en: Well, what do you guys think about hockey?
segments.cn: 好吧，你们对冰球有什么看法？

segments.en: We'll post some videos and some pictures of hockey on the comment section so you can more or less see a little bit more about this really interesting sport.
segments.cn: 我们会在评论区发布一些冰球的视频和图片，这样你们可以更多地了解这个非常有趣的运动。

segments.en: And tell us what you think about it.
segments.cn: 并告诉我们你对此的看法。

segments.en: Yeah, so visit our website, EnglishPod.com and you'll find some interesting stuff about hockey, right?
segments.cn: 是的，访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，你会发现一些关于冰球的有趣内容，对吧？

segments.en: And also lots of other great lessons.
segments.cn: 还有很多其他很棒的课程。

segments.en: And also if you have any questions or doubts about the lesson, you can leave your questions on the site.
segments.cn: 如果你对课程有任何问题或疑问，可以在网站上留言。

segments.en: We'll see you guys next time.
